conclusion: Determine electric field and potential at center O after placing opposite-sign charge at C.
Start with charges q at A and B, and -q at C.
Each side of the equilateral triangle has length r.
Distance from vertex to centroid is R = r/√3.
Electric field due to charge q at distance R is E = kq/R².
Electric fields at O due to A and B are E_A = kq/R² and E_B = kq/R².
Electric field at O due to -q at C is E_C = kq/R², pointing outward.
Total electric field at O is E_total = kq/R².
Initial electric field at O is E = k(3q)/r².
Electric potential due to charge q at distance r is V = kq/r.
Potentials at O due to A, B, and C are V_A = V_B = k√3q/r, V_C = -k√3q/r.
Total potential at O is V_total = k√3q/r.
Magnitude of electric field at O is k(3q)/r².
